VFDDisplay â€“ Build Command Cheat Sheet

List examples
- make list

Build an example (default backend: PlatformIO)
- make <Example>
- make <Example> debug

Upload (set your port)
- make <Example>.upload PORT=/dev/ttyACM0
- make <Example>.upload PORT=/dev/ttyACM0 BAUD=115200 PROTOCOL=wiring

Force backend
- make -- --pio <Example>
- make -- --arduino <Example>
- make -- --avr <Example>

Protocol override (either form)
- make -- --protocol=wiring <Example>.upload PORT=/dev/ttyACM0
- make <Example>.upload PORT=/dev/ttyACM0 PROTOCOL=wiring

Clean
- make clean        # remove .build/<backend>
- make deepclean    # clean + remove .pio caches

PlatformIO (direct, per example)
- pio run -d examples/<Example> -e megaatmega2560
- pio run -d examples/<Example> -e megaatmega2560 -t upload --upload-port /dev/ttyACM0
- pio device monitor -b 57600 -p /dev/ttyACM0

Arduino CLI (direct)
- arduino-cli compile --fqbn arduino:avr:mega examples/<Example>
- arduino-cli upload -p /dev/ttyACM0 --fqbn arduino:avr:mega examples/<Example>

avr-gcc + avrdude (via Makefile)
- make -- --avr <Example>
- make -- --avr <Example>.upload PORT=/dev/ttyACM0 BAUD=57600 PROTOCOL=stk500

Tests
- make tests             # discover
- make tests/all         # build all
- make tests/<path>      # build one (add UPLOAD=1 PORT=... to upload)

Tools
- make vfd-sender        # GUI sender (PySide6 + pyserial)
